item.title: Report X-2025050087
item.description:
Report X-2025050087

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a spill agent was called for a leaking shipment. The spill agent didn't see any signs of a release but the shipment was warm to the touch. While investigating the shipment they found two lithium batteries inside packaged with styrofoam for dunnage. One battery was melted and extremely warm to the touch. Both batteries were placed into steel salvage package and are being held at the location.

item.title: Report X-2025041388
item.description:
Report X-2025041388

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the loading process at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was dropped. The fiberboard box hit the edge of the catwalk puncturing one of the three metal can inside. Contents were packaged with positive closure rings and fiberboard dividers. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2025040456
item.description:
Report E-2025040456

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 16, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1263 was punctured and released approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSEs) to remediate the site. Crews deployed absorbents to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spend absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. The damaged drum was placed into one (1) 85-gallon drum.
